documentType: grand jury subpoena response with attached records
summary: This document is a certification from Bear Stearns Companies, Inc. in response to a federal grand jury subpoena, attesting to the authenticity of attached business records. The attached records include a detailed log of messages and activities for Jeffrey Epstein dated April 5, 2005, travel itineraries for August 2007, and an FBI lead sheet from 2008 regarding child prostitution. It provides a snapshot of Epstein's daily communications, financial dealings, and travel, as well as law enforcement communication about the case. This document set includes a property record search result, two nearly identical DOJ letters granting access to grand jury materials for 'Operation LeapYear', an FBI fax cover sheet regarding a subpoena for American Express records related to Jeffrey Epstein, a partially completed arrest/warrant request form from Palm Beach Police, two Notice to Appear forms, and a public records request from a law firm seeking evidence from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The documents show administrative and investigative steps in the Epstein case. This document is an Agreed Order from the Circuit Court of Palm Beach County, Florida, correcting a scrivener's error in the Order of Community Control for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It deletes two special conditions related to electronic monitoring that were not part of the plea agreement. The document also contains fragmented text from other sources, including a property receipt form from the Palm Beach Police Department and an FBI agent's investigative report detailing an attempt to intercept Epstein's plane in St. Thomas in August 2007.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in an FBI subpoena request for American Express records and is the subject of a public records request regarding a 2006 indictment.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: Mentioned in a realtor's message as someone the realtor has dealt with, in the context of a property.

persons.name: Karin
persons.context: Referenced in a message about a Letter of Credit; her bank (Mellon) is mentioned.

persons.name: Squishy
persons.context: Epstein's pet for which a vet appointment was made to get an ID chip for traveling abroad.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Signatory of DOJ letters granting individuals access to grand jury materials for 'Operation LeapYear'.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (Case No.: 08CF009381AXXXMB). An Agreed Order corrects his community control conditions by removing electronic monitoring requirements.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's defense attorney who agreed to the court order correcting the scrivener's error regarding electronic monitoring conditions.

persons.name: Barbara Burns
persons.context: Prosecutor who agreed to the court order correcting the scrivener's error in Epstein's community control order.

persons.name: Jeffrey C. B.
persons.context: The judge who signed the Agreed Order correcting the community control conditions for Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Ghislaine is mentioned in a real estate context, indicating a prior business or social connection.

Acosta, as a U.S. Attorney, was involved in the legal process surrounding the Epstein investigation, as evidenced by his authorization of grand jury access related to the broader 'Operation LeapYear'.
Goldberger is identified as the attorney for the defendant, Jeffrey Epstein, in the court case.
Both are attorneys (defense and prosecution) who agreed to the court order correcting the scrivener's error.

events.title: Epstein's Daily Log
events.description: A detailed log of messages, calls, and reminders for Jeffrey Epstein covering travel plans, meetings, financial discussions (including a $1.3 million loss), social events (Robin Hood Benefit), and personal matters.

events.title: New York Travel
events.description: Travel itinerary for a trip from West Palm Beach to New York City, including flights, a stay at the Grand Hyatt, and a car rental.

events.title: FBI Lead Delivery
events.description: An Assistant Legal Attach√© in Sydney delivered a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to a foreign police agency regarding a child prostitution matter.

events.title: Palm Beach County Grand Jury Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury issued an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: DOJ Grants Access to Grand Jury Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent letters granting individuals access to grand jury materials for 'Operation LeapYear'.

events.title: Public Records Request for Epstein Evidence
events.description: The law firm Ricci-Leopold filed a public records request seeking all evidence and documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and indictment.

events.title: Agreed Order Correcting Scrivener's Error
events.description: The Circuit Court issues an order, agreed upon by defense and prosecution, to delete special conditions #26 and #27 (electronic monitoring) from Epstein's Order of Community Control, as they were not part of the plea agreement.

events.title: Attempt to Intercept Epstein's Plane in St. Thomas
events.description: An FBI agent (writer) receives a call about Epstein's private plane (N90932) preparing to depart St. Thomas. The agent coordinates with Homeland Security, Customs and Border Protection, and Air Traffic Control to potentially delay the flight to serve target letters on two female passengers believed to be aboard. The plane is boarded and checked; only Epstein is found to be traveling.

locations: Cyril B. King Airport, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Bear Stearns provided certified business records to a federal grand jury subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein.

Epstein's 2005 message log reveals discussions of significant financial losses (e.g., "Nestor is 0, now a total loss of 1.3 million"), travel, social events, and meetings concerning "girls" and "sisters".
An August 2007 travel itinerary shows Epstein's trip to New York, staying at the Grand Hyatt.
An FBI communication from December 2008 shows international coordination to deliver a U.S. Attorney's Office letter regarding a child prostitution lead.
The document includes a LexisNexis report on an individual in Queens, NY, potentially related to the investigation.
The documents reference 'Operation LeapYear', a federal grand jury investigative matter for which the DOJ granted individuals access to secret materials.
An FBI subpoena was issued for American Express records associated with Jeffrey Epstein and several other names for the period January 2004 to January 2006.
A public records request from September 2008 specifically seeks all evidence related to the Palm Beach County Grand Jury indictment of Jeffrey Epstein issued on July 19, 2006.
The documents include administrative police forms (arrest request, Notice to Appear) from the Palm Beach Police Department, indicating local law enforcement involvement.
R. Alexander Acosta, then Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, signed letters related to grand jury secrecy and access.

A court order corrects a scrivener's error, formally removing electronic monitoring requirements from Jeffrey Epstein's community control conditions, indicating they were not part of his original plea deal.
In August 2007, federal agents attempted to intercept Epstein's private plane in St. Thomas based on information that two female 'targets' were aboard; only Epstein was found on the plane.
The investigative report shows coordination between the FBI, Customs and Border Protection (CBP), and Air Traffic Control to monitor and potentially delay a flight in a criminal investigation.
The document contains fragmented police property receipt forms from the Palm Beach Police Department, though no specific property or individuals are clearly identifiable from the garbled text.
